articles.description: The addition of people 65 and up and those with some medical issues will add about 400,000 Nebraskans to the list of those next in line to be vaccinated against
articles.content: In addition to adding people ages 65 and older to the next phase of COVID-19 vaccine recipients, Nebraska state health officials also are working with health care systems to further define what high-… [+1303 chars]

articles.title: What CDC data says about coronavirus vaccine side effects - KPRC 2 Click2Houston
articles.description: The effects of coronavirus appear to have no rhyme or reason, and some say that the same can be said of the vaccine.

articles.author: Natalie Rahhal U.S.
articles.title: Two babies 'caught' cancer from their mothers during childbirth - Daily Mail
articles.description: They likely inhaled cervical cancer cells that had mixed with amniotic fluid in their mothers' birth canals, and the cancer took hold in their lungs. Only 20 cases have been reported.
articles.content:
Two children in Japan 'caught' cancer from their mothers, in a rare medical phenomenon, new case reports. 
They likely inhaled cancer cells from their mothers, each of whom unwittingly had cervical … [+4037 chars]

articles.title: Toothbrush Disinfection May Protect Against COVID-19 - Medscape
articles.description: Brazilian dentists propose a protocol for toothbrush disinfection as a measure to limit SARS-CoV-2 transmission in communal spaces.
articles.content:
SARS-CoV-2 can be transmitted, even from asymptomatic individuals, in different ways, including droplets, aerosols and, to a lesser degree, fomites.
